anns.prefix: Three antibacterial metabolites were characterized from X. nematophila strain K102 (CNCM I-4530): NOSO-95A (MW: 1,296 Da),
Three antibacterial metabolites were characterized from X. nematophila strain K102 (CNCM I-4530): NOSO-95A (MW: 1,296 Da), NOSO-95B (MW: 1,280 Da), and

anns.postfix: was the first of these compounds for which total chemical synthesis was completed, and this compound was, therefore, chosen for this study.

anns.prefix: Interestingly,
anns.postfix: was less active against some members of the Morganellaceae family, such as Providencia stuartii ATCC 29914 and Proteus mirabilis ATCC 29906, with MICs of 16 μg/mL and 32 μg/mL, respectively, and was inactive against other members of this family, such as Morganella morganii DSM 30164 and the ODL-producing strain X. nematophila K102, with a MIC of >2,048 μg/mL, confirming that ODL producers develop mechanisms of self-resistance to ODLs (Table 1).

Our study clearly reveals that the resistance gene, oatA, is found exclusively in
anns.postfix: bacteria.

anns.prefix: It is therefore confined to
anns.postfix: insects and IJs harboring specific bacterial symbiont species.

anns.prefix: This raises the question of whether the ODLs exert selection pressure in
anns.postfix: cadavers, favoring the HGT of the oatA self-resistance gene to bacteria with no intrinsic ODL production capacity.

anns.prefix: It has been shown in bacterial competition experiments that Staphylococcus saprophyticus is eliminated following its introduction into growing cultures in vitro (mimicking the hemolymph) of either the
anns.postfix: mutant strain or the ODL mutant strain but that this bacterium is able to grow in the presence of the ngrA strain, indicating that the main water-soluble antimicrobial agent, xenocoumacin, and ODLs were not required to eliminate the competitor.

anns.prefix: Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. For identification of the
anns.postfix: self-resistance gene, the regions upstream and downstream from the odl locus of X. nematophila F1 were amplified by PCR with the L-ectB-KpnI and R-c-SacI primers (for abc genes) or the L-d-KpnI and R-j-SacI primers (for defghij genes), respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. Genes a, b, and c were amplified separately, by PCR, with L-ectB-KpnI and R-ectB-SacI, L-b-KpnI and R-b-SacI, and L-c-KpnI and R-c-SacI, respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. All these constructs were used to transform E. coli XL1-Blue MRF′ and were assessed separately in odilorhabdin MIC assays after the addition of IPTG.

belongs to the GNAT superfamily, a group of enzymes catalyzing the transfer of an acetyl group from acetyl-CoA to a primary amine in diverse acceptor molecules.

anns.prefix: Cloning, overexpression, and purification of
anns.postfix: , overexpression, and purification of OatA. Cloning, overexpression, and purification of OatA. For purification of the N-acetyltransferase, the oatA gene was first amplified from X. nematophila genomic DNA with the F-Nterm-oatA-NdeI and R-Stop-oatA-SalI primers (Table S2), digested with NdeI and SalI, and inserted into pET-28a previously digested with the same enzymes, at a position downstream from the T7 promoter and in fusion with the His tag, yielding pET-oatA. Fresh precultures of the overexpressing strain BL21(DE3) harboring the pET-oatA plasmid were grown overnight in 20 mL of LB broth supplemented with 20 μg/mL of kanamycin at 35°C.

Fresh precultures of the overexpressing strain BL21(DE3) harboring the pET-oatA plasmid were grown overnight in 20 mL of LB broth supplemented with 20 μg/mL of kanamycin at 35°C.

anns.postfix: of translation (18).

anns.prefix: We found that all X. nematophila strains, including the first ODL-producing strain ever described, K102, harbored the complete 44.5-kb locus carrying both the odl-BGC and the
anns.postfix: gene, oatA. Complete odl loci, including oatA genes, were also present in P. laumondii and some Photorhabdus species (P. luminescens, P. laumondii, and P. kayaii).

anns.prefix: These features suggest that the large modular locus involved in ODL synthesis and
anns.postfix: to ODLs was recently constructed by the addition of genomic modules in an as-yet-unidentified ancestor, followed by horizontal transfer to some Photorhabdus and X. nematophila species.

anns.prefix: As described previously (42), such MGEs are composed of different genomic subregions, in this case the ODL synthesis and the ODL
anns.postfix: subregions.

anns.prefix: Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. For identification of the odilorhabdin
anns.postfix: gene, the regions upstream and downstream from the odl locus of X. nematophila F1 were amplified by PCR with the L-ectB-KpnI and R-c-SacI primers (for abc genes) or the L-d-KpnI and R-j-SacI primers (for defghij genes), respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. Genes a, b, and c were amplified separately, by PCR, with L-ectB-KpnI and R-ectB-SacI, L-b-KpnI and R-b-SacI, and L-c-KpnI and R-c-SacI, respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. All these constructs were used to transform E. coli XL1-Blue MRF′ and were assessed separately in odilorhabdin MIC assays after the addition of IPTG.

anns.prefix: Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. For identification of the odilorhabdin self-resistance gene, the regions upstream and downstream from the odl locus of X. nematophila F1 were amplified by PCR with the L-ectB-KpnI and R-c-SacI primers (for
anns.postfix: genes) or the L-d-KpnI and R-j-SacI primers (for defghij genes), respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. Genes a, b, and c were amplified separately, by PCR, with L-ectB-KpnI and R-ectB-SacI, L-b-KpnI and R-b-SacI, and L-c-KpnI and R-c-SacI, respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. All these constructs were used to transform E. coli XL1-Blue MRF′ and were assessed separately in odilorhabdin MIC assays after the addition of IPTG.

anns.postfix: and Photorhabdus (57 and 20 strains, respectively) (41).

anns.prefix: We found that all
anns.postfix: strains, including the first ODL-producing strain ever described, K102, harbored the complete 44.5-kb locus carrying both the odl-BGC and the self-resistance gene, oatA. anns.prefix: Table 3 clearly shows that the cloning and expression of the oatA genes from Photorhabdus and X. nematophila rendered E. coli resistant to NOSO-95C, with a MIC of at least 512 μg/mL. However, no significant resistance to NOSO-95C (Table 3) was observed after the cloning of
anns.postfix: orphan oatA-like genes displaying full sequence identity to oatA-Xn or truncated sequences (Fig. S8).

anns.prefix: It has been shown in bacterial competition experiments that
anns.postfix: is eliminated following its introduction into growing cultures in vitro (mimicking the hemolymph) of either the xenocoumacin mutant strain or the ODL mutant strain but that this bacterium is able to grow in the presence of the ngrA strain, indicating that the main water-soluble antimicrobial agent, xenocoumacin, and ODLs were not required to eliminate the competitor.

anns.prefix: In addition, natural infection experiments with insect larvae have shown that NgrA-independent antibiotics are involved in
anns.postfix: control.

anns.postfix: serve as signals for nematode reproduction in vivo (30).

anns.prefix: Insertion of diverse genes into
anns.postfix: XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. Insertion of diverse genes into E. coli XL1 Blue MRF′. For identification of the odilorhabdin self-resistance gene, the regions upstream and downstream from the odl locus of X. nematophila F1 were amplified by PCR with the L-ectB-KpnI and R-c-SacI primers (for abc genes) or the L-d-KpnI and R-j-SacI primers (for defghij genes), respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. Genes a, b, and c were amplified separately, by PCR, with L-ectB-KpnI and R-ectB-SacI, L-b-KpnI and R-b-SacI, and L-c-KpnI and R-c-SacI, respectively, and inserted into pUC19 digested with KpnI and SacI. All these constructs were used to transform E. coli XL1-Blue MRF′ and were assessed separately in odilorhabdin MIC assays after the addition of IPTG.

anns.prefix: We assessed the functionality of diverse OatA proteins from Photorhabdus strains or OatA-like proteins from
anns.postfix: strains, by amplifying the corresponding genes by PCR with appropriate primers (Table S2) and inserting the amplicon between the KpnI and SacI sites of pUC19.

anns.prefix: The resulting constructs were then used to transform the
anns.postfix: XL1 Blue MRF′ strain, and odilorhabdin MIC assays were performed after adding IPTG.

anns.prefix: The ngrA PCR fragment was inserted into the pBBR1-MCS2 broad-host-range vector with the L-ngrA-EcoRI and R-ngrA-BamHI primers digested with EcoRI and BamHI, and the resulting construct was used to transform
anns.postfix: XL1 Blue MRF′ before the addition of p15A-Ptet-odl-BGC.

anns.prefix: Cloning, overexpression, and purification of OatA. Cloning, overexpression, and purification of OatA. Cloning, overexpression, and purification of OatA. For purification of the N-acetyltransferase, the oatA gene was first amplified from
anns.postfix: genomic DNA with the F-Nterm-oatA-NdeI and R-Stop-oatA-SalI primers (Table S2), digested with NdeI and SalI, and inserted into pET-28a previously digested with the same enzymes, at a position downstream from the T7 promoter and in fusion with the His tag, yielding pET-oatA. Fresh precultures of the overexpressing strain BL21(DE3) harboring the pET-oatA plasmid were grown overnight in 20 mL of LB broth supplemented with 20 μg/mL of kanamycin at 35°C.

anns.prefix: For the construction of a ΔoatA mutant, we first constructed an ngrA-deficient strain, to prevent the suicide of the
anns.postfix: producer strain.

anns.prefix: The resulting plasmid, pJQ-ngrA::ΩCm, was used to transform
anns.postfix: and was introduced into X. nematophila F1 by mating.

anns.prefix: The resulting plasmid, pJQ-ngrA::ΩCm, was used to transform E. coli strain WM3064 and was introduced into
anns.postfix: F1 by mating.

anns.prefix: The pJQ-oatA::KmT1 plasmid was then introduced, by mating, into the
anns.postfix: ngrA mutant, and allelic exchange was performed.

anns.prefix: For
anns.postfix: constructs, a modified method of inoculum preparation was used in which about 10 colonies were picked from MH agar supplemented with 100 μg/mL of ampicillin and used to inoculate 10 mL of MHB II supplemented with 100 μg/mL of ampicillin.

anns.prefix: For other
anns.postfix: constructs requiring aTc induction, aTc was added to the isolate used for streaking and the reaction medium at a concentration of 200 ng/mL. In all other respects, the procedure corresponded to the CLSI method.
